questions.question: 1. Gel electrophoresis is used to separate DNA fragments on the basis of which property?

explanations.a: gel electrophoresis separates DNA fragments on the basis of their size.
explanations.b: color is used only to study the plates after migration is done.
explanations.c: functions of DNA do not play any role in separation.
explanations.d: chromosomes of DNA do not play any role in separation.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following statements about agarose gel electrophoresis is False?

answers.a: Electrophoresis in agarose is a common way to separate DNA molecules according to size
answers.b: Ethidium bromide is used to detect DNA
answers.c: Under the influence of the electrical field, positively charged DNA will migrate towards the negative charged end of the gel.
answers.d: Dye is sprayed at the end of the run.

explanations.a: Gel Electrophoresis (where the gel is agarose) is used to separate and study DNA fragments.
explanations.b: Ethidium bromide is a buffer used to increase mobility of DNA fragments and not detection
explanations.c: DNA is negatively charged and moves towards the positively charged end of the well.
explanations.d: Dye is added before loading the DNA into the wells.

questions.question: 3. Why do scientists load DNA of known sizes into the agarose gel?

answers.a: It makes it easier to determine sizes of unknowns using comparison techniques.
answers.b: To fill in all the slots on the gel so you can run it.
answers.c: To practice loading the DNA before you get to the important DNA.
answers.d: So you know how long the gel needs to run.

explanations.a: You can then estimate the size of the DNA in the sample by matching them against the closest band in the marker.
explanations.b: Empty slots can be kept in the gel too without any issues.
explanations.c: DNA marker (DNA of known size) has nothing to do with practicing loading DNA.
explanations.d: Dye is added to all DNA samples to mark the time of run.

questions.question: 4. A student performed a gel electrophoresis experiment. The results are represented in the diagram below. Compared to the fragments at the top of the gel, the fragments at the lower end are:

explanations.a: The longer distance they travel the faster they are moving. Hence the ones at the lower end have travelled faster.
explanations.c: smaller molecules travel faster and will reach the lower end quicker.
